headline: Why Packaging Corporation of America (PKG) Shares Are Falling Today
summary: Shares of packaging Corporation of America (NYSE:PKG) fell 3.8% in the afternoon session after the company reported third-quarter earnings that missed analyst expectations and issued weaker-than-expected guidance for the fourth quarter. The industrial products company posted earnings of $2.73 per share, which was $0.10 below the consensus estimate of $2.83. While sales and net income did increase compared to the same quarter in the previous year, the miss on profit expectations soured investor s

headline: Illinois Tool Tops Q3 Earnings Estimates, Updates 2025 View
summary: ITW posts 6% earnings rise and beats estimates with $2.81 per share, while modest sales growth and improved margins highlight Q3 strength.

headline: Packaging Corporation of America reports Q3 2025 earnings growth
summary: Net sales for the quarter reached $2.31bn, an increase from $2.18bn a year earlier.

raw.headline: Packaging Corporation of America reports Q3 2025 earnings growth

headline: 3 Mid-Cap Stocks We Think Twice About
summary: Many investors pay attention to mid-cap stocks because they have established business models and expansive market opportunities. However, their paths to becoming $100 billion corporations are ripe with competition, ranging from giants with vast resources to agile upstarts eager to disrupt the status quo.

headline: Packaging Corporation of America (PKG) Earnings Jump 26%, Reinforcing Bullish Profitability Narratives
summary: Packaging Corporation of America (PKG) posted a 26% increase in earnings over the past year, far outpacing its 5-year average growth rate of 6.6% per year. Net profit margins improved to 10.4% from last year’s 9%, and shares recently traded at $213.26. The current price-to-earnings ratio of 21.2x sits below the peer average of 32.9x. Investors may take additional confidence from PKG’s high quality earnings and ongoing profit growth. However, forecasts now call for a more modest 9.1% annual...
